caption: SGBudget2025: The Home Team continues to do well in keeping Singapore safe and secure. Singaporeans remain confident in the Home Teams ability to carry out its mission fairly and effectively.To tackle new and evolving threats and security challenges, the Home Team will: Leverage technologies such as Artificial Intelligence for organisational effectiveness, equip our officers with the competencies to use them, and review our laws and regulatory frameworks to deal with crimes. Expand the foreign recruitment pool for Emergency Medical Services personnel and Auxiliary Police Officers with tight safeguards. Partner banks to strengthen their scam prevention measures and work on more ways to help people better identify potential scams. Strengthen Preventive Drug Education for youths, such as through schools and with parents. Fully operationalise Supervision 2.0 to enhance the supervision and reintegration of ex-drug abusers into society, as well as support the rehabilitation of inmates with initiatives that help them strengthen relationships with their families and enhance their chances for gainful employment.For more information, visit

caption: Since childhood days, Ive had the desire to be part of the uniform services and contribute to the security of our nation. These aspirations were fuelled by family and friends who had careers in SCDF, Prisons and SPF. What drove me to apply for a scholarship with the Home Team and to choose ICA was because of the diversity of roles undertaken by ICA to secure the borders. Now that Im working on the frontline at Tuas Checkpoint, I have the opportunity of working alongside other HTDs like the Police and CNB to prevent the entry of undesirable persons and goods to keep Singapore safe and secure.I also had the opportunity to work on ICAs New Clearance Concept to enhance our systems and processes, ensuring that we are ready to tackle new challenges with the evolving operating terrain. My team and I will continue to carry out our duties in a professional manner to inspire public confidence and trust in the Home Team. caption: When SGT2 Mohamad Rizuan Bin Amin first joined the Immigration and Checkpoints Authority (ICA) in 2008, he was posted to the Coastal Command (Singapore Cruise Centre) as a Primary Screening Officer conducting immigration clearance at the counter. Shortly after, he joined the Clearance Team, where he had the opportunity to go out to sea to clear crew onboard sea vessels. I also dealt with drugs, contraband, illegal immigrants, and other prohibited items. One of my biggest contraband cases to date was a joint operation with other agencies in 2012 at Jurong River. Each agency played a part in nabbing those involved in the smuggling from sea (smugglers) to land (handlers and distributors), and we managed to retrieve over 2,000 cartons of contraband cigarettes at the end.It was memorable as it was a unique experience, and I felt a sense of satisfaction being part of this operation. - SGT2 Rizuan, ICA.SGT2 Rizuan was posted to Tuas Checkpoint in 2018 and is currently taking on the role of a mentor for cargo clearance and a certified Image Analyst.: .....OneHomeTeam ImmigrationandCheckpointsAuthority GuardiansofOurBorders SecureBordersSafeSG
cleaned_caption:
When SGT2 first joined the Immigration and Checkpoints Authority (ICA) in 2008, he was posted to the Coastal Command (Singapore Cruise Centre) as a Primary Screening Officer conducting immigration clearance at the counter. Shortly after, he joined the Clearance Team, where he had the opportunity to go out to sea to clear crew onboard sea vessels. He also dealt with drugs, contraband, illegal immigrants, and other prohibited items. One of the biggest contraband cases to date was a joint operation with other agencies in 2012 at Jurong River. Each agency played a part in nabbing those involved in the smuggling from sea (smugglers) to land (handlers and distributors), and they managed to retrieve over 2,000 cartons of contraband cigarettes at the end. It was memorable as it was a unique experience, and he felt a sense of satisfaction being part of this operation. SGT2 was posted to Tuas Checkpoint in 2018 and is currently taking on the role of a mentor for cargo clearance and a certified Image Analyst. 

#OneHomeTeam #ImmigrationandCheckpointsAuthority #GuardiansofOurBorders #SecureBordersSafeSG

caption: CI (2) Syed Aziz once had to deal with an aggressive subject who dashed through the immigration gates to evade immigration checks back when he was posted to Changi Airport.I was initially worried that the subject could be a major security threat, but as he seemed mentally troubled, I quickly transitioned into the role of a counsellor. Later, I understood that he was remanded at the Institute of Mental Health (IMH) and was assessed to be mentally unsound. After further investigations, he was eventually repatriated back to his home country. I am glad that the training I received as a para-counsellor in ICA has equipped me well to deal with such situations. - CI (2) Syed Aziz, Immigration & Checkpoints Authority.While such cases do not occur on a daily basis, it demonstrates the importance of empathy and communication that an ICA officer needs to have, in order to keep our borders safe and secure.CI (2) Syed Aziz is currently posted to Tuas Checkpoint as a Cargo Screening Officer where he ensures that dangerous and undesirable goods are not allowed to enter Singapore.: .....OneHomeTeam ImmigrationAndCheckpointsAuthority SecureBordersSafeSG GuardiansOfOurBorders

Later, I understood that he was remanded at the Institute of Mental Health (IMH) and was assessed to be mentally unsound. caption: As Head of the Responder Performance Centre at the Civil Defence Academy (CDA), Lieutenant-Colonel (LTC) Lee Soon Huat of the Singapore Civil Defence Force (SCDF) helps firefighters become operationally ready for any emergency, from a house fire to an urban search-and-rescue operation.What I love about being a trainer is that it reminds me of the importance of continuous learning. I regularly upskill myself by attending trainer development courses. Through such courses, I level-up on ways to use multimedia for blended learning, assess learning behaviours and build my Trainees competencies. Refining our firefighting and lifesaving practices, streamlining drills and ironing out any kinks in our lessons makes for a constantly improved training experience. cleaned_caption: Have you wondered what kind of investigative work takes place at the scene of an explosion? After an explosion, a team of Forensics Specialists from the Home Team Science and Technology will make their way through the scene and look for clues to analyse the aftermath of that explosion. As post-blast investigators, we are trying to work backwards in order to reconstruct a scene and catch the suspects. caption: Police Defence Tactics (PDT) is an essential part of a officers training. It encompasses a range of techniques that prepare officers for the dynamic operating environments and threats they encounter in the line of duty.The fundamentals of PDT is teaching officers to stay vigilant, remain calm, evaluate the threat posed to officers and members of the public and decide on the most appropriate course of action, including the force thats needed, to swiftly mitigate the threat.As of 16 May 2021, training critical to operations, such as Basic Courses and Ground Response Forces Training, will continue at the Home Team Academy and Civil Defence Academy. All other training will either be moved online, or deferred till after 13 June 2021......OneHomeTeam SingaporePoliceForce SafeguardingEveryday TrainingandLearning SGUnited SGTogether
cleaned_caption: Police Defence Tactics (PDT) is an essential part of officers' training. It encompasses a range of techniques that prepare officers for the dynamic operating environments and threats they encounter in the line of duty. The fundamentals of PDT teach officers to stay vigilant, remain calm, evaluate the threat posed to officers and members of the public, and decide on the most appropriate course of action, including the force that’s needed, to swiftly mitigate the threat. As of 16 May 2021, training critical to operations, such as Basic Courses and Ground Response Forces Training, will continue at the Home Team Academy and Civil Defence Academy. All other training will either be moved online or deferred till after 13 June 2021. OneHomeTeam SingaporePoliceForce SafeguardingEveryday TrainingandLearning SGUnited SGTogether

caption: The vaccination exercise for Home Team officers involved in frontline healthcare operations started this morning (11 January 2021).The first Home Team healthcare frontliner vaccinated was Warrant Officer 1 Mohamed Shafiee Bin Jamin, 38. WO1 Shafiee is an Singapore Civil Defence Force (SCDF) paramedic from Kallang Fire Station whose role involves responding to day-to-day medical emergencies.Other Home Team healthcare frontliners vaccinated today include LTC Janice Oh, 42. LTC Oh is a Senior Assistant Director from SCDFs EMS Department. In addition to planning the policies and exercises for the EMS team including the COVID-19 response and vaccination exercise, LTC Oh is also involved in frontline paramedic duties.A total of 1,050 officers from the 's Emergency Medical Services (EMS) officers, staff from the Home Team Medical Services Division, and other frontline officers from the and Singapore Prison Service will be progressively vaccinated over the coming weeks.

caption: You need to understand your mens strengths while also being able to lead by example. Leadership isnt about the epaulettes on your shoulder or the appointment you hold. At the end of the day, its about whether your men trust and follow you. Ultimately, we succeed as a team. LTA Taran Franck, ROTA Commander (NS), Bukit Batok Fire StationLTA Taran Franck went through Rota Commander Course (RCC), a rigorous seven-month programme designed to inculcate critical leadership attributes and lifesaving skills in SCDF officers.Due to COVID-19, SCDF Officer Cadets took the necessary safety measures in their stride, wearing masks and training in smaller groups as they pushed on to complete their RCC training and become professional lifesavers.......OneHomeTeam SGUnited SGTogether ANationofLifesavers SingaporeCivilDefenceForce

caption: Other than being law enforcers, we have also learnt the softer skills of serving and helping out fellow mankind. Marcus Chow, Home Team Academy Officer. Marcus was in-charge and heavily involved in co-ordinating the setting up of the Government Quarantine Facilities (GQF) and its safety and security. He and his team looked into the various needs for the Persons Under Quarantine at the GQF. Despite the challenges faced, he has also learnt to be more empathetic and helpful to the society.
